sen.j: 上坂神社（こうさかじんじゃ）は、滋賀県長浜市東上坂町にある神社である。
sen.e: Kosaka-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine that exists in Higashikozaka-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
Kosaka-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Higashikozaka-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: that existsをlocatedに変更しました。
sen.e: Kosaka-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Higashikozaka-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
It is Kokushi genzaisha (shrines not listed in the registers but mentioned in the Six National Histories).
sen.cmt: 国史見在社の説明を追記しました。http://books.google.co.jp/books?ei=LYRjTICcDZCEuwOAt9GeCg&ct=result&id=gNslAQAAIAAJ&dq=kokushi+genzaisha&q=kokushi+genzaisha
sen.e: It is Kokushi genzaisha (shrines not listed in the registers but mentioned in the Six National Histories).
It is also called Kamisakata-gu Shrine.
It is also called Kamisakata-gu Shrine.
It is also called Kamisakata-gu Shrine.
It was a prefectural shrine in the old classification of shrines.
It was a prefectural shrine in the old classification of shrines.
It was a prefectural shrine in the old classification of shrines.

sen.cmt: 「大瓜五葉」の読みは不明です。

sen.j: 社伝によると、孝霊天皇25年に創建されたと伝わる。
sen.e: According to the shrine's biography, it was built in 266 B.C.
According to the shrine's biography, it was built in 266 B.C.
According to the shrine's biography, it was built in 266 B.C.

sen.j: 上坂田郷の惣社である。
sen.e: It is the soja (representative shrine) of Kamisakata area.
It is the soja (representative shrine) of Kamisakata area.
It is the soja (representative shrine) of Kamisakata area.

sen.j: 『三代実録』によると貞観 (日本)17年に従五位下を賜ったという。
sen.e: According to "Sandai jitsuroku (a history book written in the Heian period)" the shrine was given Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
According to "Sandai jitsuroku (a history book written in the Heian period)," the shrine was given Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 875.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを追記しました。
sen.e: According to "Sandai jitsuroku (a history book written in the Heian period)," the shrine was given Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 875.
It is Kokushi genzaisha (shrines not listed in the registers but mentioned in the Six National Histories).
sen.cmt: 国史見在社の説明を追記しました。http://books.google.co.jp/books?ei=LYRjTICcDZCEuwOAt9GeCg&ct=result&id=gNslAQAAIAAJ&dq=kokushi+genzaisha&q=kokushi+genzaisha
sen.e: It is Kokushi genzaisha (shrines not listed in the registers but mentioned in the Six National Histories).

sen.j: 京極氏、織田信長、豊臣秀吉の崇敬を受けた。
sen.e: It was venerated by Kyogoku clan, Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
It was venerated by the Kyogoku clan, Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: 京極氏にtheを追記しました。
sen.e: It was venerated by the Kyogoku clan, Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 明治9年に村社、大正12年に県社に列した。
sen.e: It was listed as sonsha (village shrine) in 1876 and kensha (prefectural shrine) in 1923.
It was listed as sonsha (village shrine) in 1876 and kensha (prefectural shrine) in 1923.
It was listed as sonsha (village shrine) in 1876 and kensha (prefectural shrine) in 1923.
